newsitem.title: USA: Blue-chip stocks track falling bonds on weekly retail sales.
newsitem.headline: Blue-chip stocks track falling bonds on weekly retail sales.

text.p: Blue-chip stocks fell Tuesday as the market moved in lock-step with falling Treasury bonds following stronger-than-expected weekly retail sales.
Based on early and unofficial data, the Dow Jones industrial average was off 101.27 points, or 1.2 percent, at 7,960.84, its first close below the 8,000 level since July 21.
In the broader market, declining issues beat advances 15-12 on volume of 502 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
In the bond market, the benchmark 30-year Treasury bond slumped 14/32, and the yield jumped to 6.68 percent from 6.64 percent at Monday's close. Bond prices and yields move in opposite directions.
